comments:
Created an attachment (id=77972)
Snippet from log.

Build ID: 3.3.0

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Open file from project, and make it dirty.
2. Delete project from workspace (not contents), keeping dirty file open.
3. Close Eclipse and choose No when eclipse asks for saving dirty file.

A NPE with text: "Unable to save Workspace - Java" and "Unable to save editor: Test.java" pop up when closing Eclipse.

When restarting Eclipse a popup displays: Error opening the editor. No input factory ID found for editor.

More information:
snippet from log attached.
Not sure if this is us, JDT, or Resources. Trying IDE first...
This is an EFS related issue.
This is the FileEditorInput.getPath issue... bug 199770 or bug 187877.
Lets verify this is fixed in M2 then.

We now throw an IllegalArgumentException so this is fixed but I think we could be more graceful - we should keep this open.

We should not write the memento in case of deleted editor input.

Fixed in HEAD.
Available in builds > I20071113-0800.
